data:
This guideline applies to:
- Patient with known or suspected adrenal insufficiency, central diabetes insipidus, and.or hyperinsulinism
- Procedure is shorter than two hours in duration, with immediate ability to resume oral intake (e.g. endoscopy, adenotonsillectomy, lumbar puncture, some dental procedures)
- Procedure will be performed under sedation or general anesthetics

Please obtain a pre-anesthesia and pediatric endocrinology consultation should the procedure be anticipated to be longer than two hours in duration or patient has delayed ability to resume oral intake post operatively
Select height for patients with adrenal insufficiency
Measure height to calculate body surface area (m2)
Baseline blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate and temperature, then q1h
Baseline blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate and temperature, then q2h
Baseline blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate and temperature, then q4h
Baseline blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate and temperature, then q8h
Baseline orthostatic blood pressure and heart rate
If sodium less than or equal to 145 mmol/L
If POC Glucose Whole Blood less than 5 mmol/L
If POC Glucose Whole Blood 5 to 8 mmol/L
If POC Glucose Whole Blood greater than 8 mmol/L
For patients with hyperinsulinism, peri-procedure (intra-operative management per anesthesia)
If patient is unconscious and/or seizing with IV access
order rate: 2 mL/kg, IV, once, PRN: hypoglycemia, drug form:bag
If patient is alert but cannot be treated with oral glucose (e.g. NPO or vomiting) without IV access
